bioghist.p: The Soup Society of Amersham (England) was organized to solicit subscriptions from residents of the parish to support the distribution of soup to the poor.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers related to the organization and operation of the Soup Society of Amersham. Materials include manuscript memoranda and plans for the society; a printed list of rules of the Society; manuscript lists of subscribers and accounts of several individual subscribers; a list of those receiving the aid; recipes for soup; information on steam kitchens, including diagrams; a small amount of information about the Spitalfield Soup Society; a manuscript copy of "Extracts of Count Rumford's Experimental Essays"; and a letter from a parish resident explaining why he declined to subscribe to the Society. The materials all appear to date from 1798-1801.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
